newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Telesp says in $100 mln deal with Alcatel.
newsitem.headline: Telesp says in $100 mln deal with Alcatel.

text.p: France's Alcatel Telecom has signed a 104 million real ($100 million) contract with Brazil's Telesp to supply equipment, material and supplies to install digital switching centrals.
A Telesp spokeswoman confirmed that the two companies signed the "turn-key" deal, but could not provide further information.
"They have signed the contract, but I don't have any details to give you," she said.
Alcatel officials could not immediately be reached for comment.
Local news agency Invest News said the deal was the largest signed so far in Brazil by Alcatel.
It said the French firm would oversee the entire project, from constructing the building that will house the centrals to bringing the lines to subscribers' homes.
Telesp is a unit of the federal Telebras system serving Sao Paulo state.
The Brazilian government plans to break up Telebras and sell off Telesp and its long-distance unit Embratel this year.
